column2: Motorize the Moskva Proletarian Strelk. Div.
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.
* Motorize the Moskva Proletarian Strelk. Div.

The Division was first formed at Petrograd, November 1918. Fought around Olonets with the 6th and 7th Armies from November 1918 into 1920. Defended the Aleksandrovsk-Melitopol railroad line on the Southern Front in August 1920. Awarded the Order of the Red Banner in October 1920. Reorganized as a brigade of the 15th Rifle Division in November 1920. It was then re-formed either in December 1924 or at the beginning of 1927 in the Moscow Military District, gaining the title of the 1st Moscow Proletariat Red Banner Rifle Division. Pavel Batov was a battalion and then regiment commander in the Division in the late 1920s. In August 1939 it raised cadres for 115th and 126th Rifle Divisions. It was re-raised from its single remaining regiment in Sept 1939 (2nd formation), but in January 1940 formed the 1st Moscow Motor Rifle Division. On 22 June 1941 it was part of 7th Mechanised Corps, alongside 14th and 18th Tank Divisions in the Moscow Military District, assigned to 20th Army.[2] It was the first Soviet formation to use T-34 tanks at Borisov on June 30, 1941. Fought at Orsha, between Minsk and Moscow, and at Yartsevo in Sep 1941.
Rename and reorganize the 1aya Moskva Motostrelkovoy Div.
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.
* Renaming to the 1aya Gvardiya Moskva Motostrelkovoy Div.

The Division was first formed at Petrograd, November 1918. Fought around Olonets with the 6th and 7th Armies from November 1918 into 1920. Defended the Aleksandrovsk-Melitopol railroad line on the Southern Front in August 1920. Awarded the Order of the Red Banner in October 1920. Reorganized as a brigade of the 15th Rifle Division in November 1920. It was then re-formed either in December 1924 or at the beginning of 1927 in the Moscow Military District, gaining the title of the 1st Moscow Proletariat Red Banner Rifle Division. Pavel Batov was a battalion and then regiment commander in the Division in the late 1920s. In August 1939 it raised cadres for 115th and 126th Rifle Divisions. It was re-raised from its single remaining regiment in Sept 1939 (2nd formation), but in January 1940 formed the 1st Moscow Motor Rifle Division. On 22 June 1941 it was part of 7th Mechanised Corps, alongside 14th and 18th Tank Divisions in the Moscow Military District, assigned to 20th Army.[2] It was the first Soviet formation to use T-34 tanks at Borisov on June 30, 1941. Fought at Orsha, between Minsk and Moscow, and at Yartsevo in Sep 1941.\nOn September 21, 1941 it was renamed to the 1st Guards Moscow Motor Rifle Division. Fought at Vyazma, Bryansk, and Rzhev. On November 1, 1942 it was part of 20th Army, Western Front. After the Rzhev-Sychevka offensive operation in 1942 it was renamed (again) as the 1st Guards Rifle Division in January 1943. In 1943 the division saw action in the Oryol, Bryansk and Gorodok offensives. Later it fought in Byelorussia, Gumbinnen, East Prussia, and Kurland. Awarded 'Minsk' honorific in July 1944. It was part of the 11th Guards Army of the 3rd ssian Front in May 1945.
Motorize the 36aya Strelk. Div. 'Transbaikalskaya'
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.
* Motorize to the 36aya Motostrelkovoy Div. 'Transbaikalskaya'
Motorization of the 36aya Strelk. Div. 'Transbaikalskaya' into the 36aya Motostrelkovoy Div. 'Transbaikalskaya'. Stationed near the town Chita in the Far Eastern region.

The first T-35s formed the 5th Separate Heavy Tank Brigade in Moscow, and paraded on May, 1st, 1936 on the Red Square. They apparently did not participate in the border wars in Mongolia, the invasion of Poland or the Winter War. By June 1940, they were seen as nearly obsolete and costly to operate, and the question was raised of their demobilization, conversion, or assignation to military academies. They were eventually transferred to the 8th Mechanized Corp in the Kiev district (Ukraine), into the 67th and 68th Tank Regiments of the 34th Tank Division. In the summer of 1941, 90% of these tanks were lost due to mechanical breakdowns, lack of maintenance, fuel, and #often sabotaged by their crews abandoning them. These figures can be explained by its sheer size and the fact it was overweight for its engine and transmission (similar to the T-28). A few surviving vehicles were recorded during the battle of Moscow during the winter 1941-42.
Form the 1st Mechanised Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.

After the success of German armor formations in France, the People's Commissariat of Defence (NKO) ordered the formation of new mechanised corps. The first nine of these were formed from summer 1940 to January 1941.\n\nHistorically, the 1st Mechanised Corps was stationed in Pskov as part of the Northwestern Front at the outbreak of the Soviet-German war, it suffered heavy losses and was disbanded in early August.
Form the 2nd Mechanised Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.

After the success of German armor formations in France, the People's Commissariat of Defence (NKO) ordered the formation of new mechanised corps. The first nine of these were formed from summer 1940 to January 1941.\n\nHistorically, the 2nd Mechanised Corps was part of the Soviet's defense of Bessarabia, being involved in the fight for the Uman-pocket in July 1941, in which it was largely destroyed.
Form the 3rd Mechanised Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.

After the success of German armor formations in France, the People's Commissariat of Defence (NKO) ordered the formation of new mechanised corps. The first nine of these were formed from summer 1940 to January 1941.\n\nHistorically, the 3rd Mechanised Corps started the German-Soviet war in Lithuania and was eventually destroyed in July 1941 near Minsk.

This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.

After the success of German armor formations in France, the People's Commissariat of Defence (NKO) ordered the formation of new mechanised corps. The first nine of these were formed from summer 1940 to January 1941.\n\nHistorically, the 4th Mechanised Corps was part of the 6th Army, Southwestern Front. It was completely destroyed in the Uman-pocket.
Form the 5th Mechanised Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.

After the success of German armor formations in France, the People's Commissariat of Defence (NKO) ordered the formation of new mechanised corps. The first nine of these were formed from summer 1940 to January 1941.\n\nHistorically, the 5th Mechanised Corps belonged to the 16th Army, originally with the Transbaikal Military District. It was ordered to deploy to the west in late May 1941. The unit was disbanded in August 1941.
Form the 6th Mechanised Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.

After the success of German armor formations in France, the People's Commissariat of Defence (NKO) ordered the formation of new mechanised corps. The first nine of these were formed from summer 1940 to January 1941.\n\nHistorically, the 6th Mechanised Corps was part of the Western Front at the beginning of the German-Soviet war. It scattered in late June during the German assault and was finally destroyed in the Bialystok-pocket in late July.

This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.

After the success of German armor formations in France, the People's Commissariat of Defence (NKO) ordered the formation of new mechanised corps. The first nine of these were formed from summer 1940 to January 1941\n\nHistorically, the 8th Mechanised Corps was part of the 26th Army, Southwestern Front at the beginning of Operation Barbarossa. It was disbanded in July 1941, with the corps command being used to establish the 38th Army.

This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.

Early 1942 saw the creation of the Tank Corps as the new main armored formation. Despite the name, these units had the size of a division. The early formations were still lacking in support-units, but the corps grew in size as the war went on.\n\nThe 1st Tank Corps can be found in Kuybyshev.

Unlike its number would suggest, the 24th Tank Corps was formed in April 1942, making it one of the earlier units of its kind.\n\nThe 24th Tank Corps can be found in Astrakhan.

column1: #### 24th Tank Corps upgrade to 2nd Guards Tank Corps ####

column2: Grant Guard status to the 24th Tank Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.

The 24th Tank Corps was granted Guard status in December 1942 for the Tatsinskaya raid, in which the corps went deep behind the German lines to assault the Tatsinskaya airfield, main transport hub for the besieged 6th Army in Stalingrad, destroying many German transport planes on the ground. In the aftermath of the raid, the Corps was itself cut off and all but destroyed.\n\nThe 2nd Guards Tank Corps can be found in Astrakhan.
Refit the 2nd Guards Tank Corps with more and better equipment
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.
The 2nd Guards Tank Corps will be refitted with better equipment.\n\nThe unit can be found in Astrakhan.
Form the 25th Tank Corps out of the 25th Mechanised Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.
The 25th Tank Corps was formed in June 1942 as one of the later corps raised.\n\nThe 25th Tank Corps can be found in Vologda.
Refit the 25th Tank Corps with more and better equipment
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.

1943 saw multiple additions to the Tank Corps Order of Battle, including assault gun and self-propelled artillery regiments as well an anti-tank regiment.\n\nThe 25th Tank Corps can be found in Vologda.
Form the 26th Tank Corps out of the 26th Mechanised Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.
The 26th Tank Corps was formed in July 1942, as the last of the Tank Corps created during spring/summer 1942.\n\nThe 26th Tank Corps can be found in Kuybyshev.

column1: #### 26th Tank Corps upgrade to 1st Guards Tank Corps ####

column2: Grant Guard status to the 26th Tank Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.
The 17th Tank Corps was granted Guard status in December 1942, gaining the title of 1st Guards Tank Corps.\n\nThe 1st Guards Tank Corps can be found in Kuybyshev.
Refit the 1st Guards Tank Corps with more and better equipment
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.
The 1st Guards Tank Corps will be refitted with better equipment.\n\nThe unit can be found in Kuybyshev.
Form the 29th Tank Corps out of the 27th Mechanised Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.
The 29th Tank Corps was one of three newly formed Tank Corps in early 1943.\n\nThe 29th Tank Corps can be found in Astrakhan.
Refit the 29th Tank Corps with more and better equipment
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.
In the later stages of the war more fire-power was added to the Tank Corps, including tank destroyers and more artillery.\n\nThe 29th Tank Corps can be found in Astrakhan.
Form the 30th Tank Corps out of the 28th Mechanised Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.
The 30th Tank Corps was the second to last Tank Corps formed, being created in March 1943. It consisted largely of recruits from the Ural.\n\nThe 30th Tank Corps can be found in Perm.

column1: #### 30th Tank Corps upgrade to 10th Guards Tank Corps ####

column2: Grant Guard status to the 30th Tank Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.
The 30th Tank Corps was granted Guard status in October 1943 and renamed 10th Guards Tank Corps.\n\nThe 10th Guards Tank Corps can be found in Kazan.
Form the 31st Tank Corps out of the 21st Mechanised Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.
Being raised in May 1943, the 31st Tank Corps was the last Tank Corps formed during the war.\n\nThe 31st Tank Corps can be found in Vologda.
Form the 10th Mechanised Corps out of the 30th Mechanised Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.
The 10th Mechanised Corps was formed in the Far East for future operations against the Japanese in Manchuria.\n\nThe 10th Mechanised Corps can be found in Khabarovsk.
Form a new 1st Mechanised Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.

Mechanised Corps were reintroduced in September 1942, with the 1st Mechanised Corps leading the way. The units generally consisted of three mechanised brigades and one tank brigade, plus further support.\n\nThe 1st Mechanised Corps can be found in Astrakhan.
Refit the 1st Mechanised Corps with more and better equipment
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.
Refit the 1st Mechanised Corps with more and better equipment.\n\nThe unit can be found in Astrakhan.
Form a new 2nd Mechanised Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.

Just like the 1st, the 2nd Mechanised Corps was formed in September 1942. The units generally consisted of three mechanised brigades and one tank brigade, plus further support.\n\nThe 2nd Mechanised Corps can be found in Astrakhan.

column1: #### 2nd Mechanised Corps upgrade to 7th Guards Mechanised Corps ####

column2: Grant Guard status to the 2nd Mechanised Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.
The 2nd Mechanised Corps was granted Guard status in July 1943, changing its name t0 7th Guards Mechanised Corps.\n\nThe unit can be found in Astrakhan.
Form a new 4th Mechanised Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.

The 4th Mechanised Corps was formed in September 1942. The units generally consisted of three mechanised brigades and one tank brigade, plus further support.\n\nThe 4th Mechanised Corps can be found in Astrakhan.

column1: #### 4th Mechanised Corps upgrade to 3rd Guards Mechanised Corps ####

column2: Grant Guard status to the 4th Mechanised Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.

The 4th Mechanised Corps was granted Guard status in December 1942 due to its role in Operation Uranus, where it spearheaded the southern pincer to cut off the 6th Army in Stalingrad. It was dubbed 3rd Guards Mechanised Corps.\n\nThe unit can be found in Astrakhan.
Refit the 3rd Guards Mechanised Corps with more and better equipment
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.
Refit the 3rd Guards Mechanised Corps with more and better equipment.\n\nThe unit can be found in Astrakhan.
Form a new 7th Mechanised Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.

The 7th Mechanised Corps became the first of a new batch of Mechanised Corps. Originally formed in early 1943 it took until autumn until the unit was fully raised.\n\nThe 7th Mechanised Corps can be found in Sarotov.
Form a new 8th Mechanised Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.
Just like the 7th, the 8th Mechanised Corps was originally formed early in the year, but it took until October 1943 until the unit was ready.\n\nThe 8th Mechanised Corps can be found in Sarotov.
Form a new 9th Mechanised Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.
The 9th Mechanised Corps was the third new Mechanised Corps formed in 1943. Just like the other two, it took until autumn to be combat-ready.\n\nThe 9th Mechanised Corps can be found in Kazan.
Form the 1st Guards Mechanised Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.

The 1st Guards Mechanised Corps was raised in November 1942 out of the 1st Guards Rifle Division as part of the re-introduction of the Mechanised Corps in the Red Army.\n\nThe 1st Guards Mechanised Corps can be found in Kuybyshev.
Refit the 1st Guards Mechanised Corps with more and better equipment
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.
Refit the 1st Guards Mechanised Corps with more and better equipment.\n\nThe unit can be found in Kuybyshev.
Form the 2nd Guards Mechanised Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.

The 2nd Guards Mechanised Corps was raised in October 1942 out of the 22nd Guards Rifle Division as part of the re-introduction of the Mechanised Corps in the Red Army.\n\nThe 2nd Guards Mechanised Corps can be found in Kuybyshev.
Refit the 2nd Guards Mechanised Corps with more and better equipment
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.
Refit the 2nd Guards Mechanised Corps with more and better equipment.\n\nThe unit can be found in Kuybyshev.
Form the 6th Guards Mechanised Corps
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.
The 6th Guards Mechanised Corps was formed in June 1943 out of the 3rd Guards Motorised Rifle Division and the 49th Mechanised Brigade.\n\nThe 6th Guards Mechanised Corps can be found in Kuybyshev.
This event allows you to choose between playing with decisions and events which will form and upgrade historical Soviet Mechanised and Tank Corps from 1940 till 1945 or playing without them.
Forming the Longe Range Air Command
This Decision will trigger an event with a choice to activate a historical unit OOB.
* Forming Longe Range Air Command.

The first three Air Armies, designated 'Air Armies of Special Purpose' were created between 1936 and 1938. 1st was created in 1 march 1936, 2nd Air Army was created on 15 March 1937 in the Far East. Somewhat later, the 3rd Air Army was created in the North Caucasus Military District. However, air armies were excluded from the organisational reform of the air forces approved on 25 July 1940. On 5 November 1940, the three existing air armies were reformed as the long range bombardment aviation of the Stavka of the Red Army due to poor combat performance during the conflict with Finland.
You can manually attach this Command to the Moscow MD theatre, as this is the closest to the Stavka.

From May - November 1942, seventeen Air Armies were created from the air forces of the Fronts and Combined Arms Armies, and in December 1944 a long-range aviation Air Army was created as the 18th Air Army.[2] The 1st Air Army was the first created, on 5 May 1942, as part of the Western Front. The next to form during 1942 were the 2nd, 3rd, 4th (22 May 1942), 5th, 6th 8th Air Armies (June 1942), 9th/10th/11th/12th (Aug 1942), 7th and 13th Air Army (November 1942), 14th, 15th, 16th, and 17th Air Armies.
